Specific Details: Proposal for amendment to Dublin City Council Draft Development Plan 2016-2022 in relation to SDRA 12 - St Teresa's Gardens & Environs -DCC will provide for the development of an integrated masterplan for the entire SDRA12 Regeneration Area. The masterplan will provide for residential, commercial and community uses, including an area of integrated sporting and active open space sufficient in size (90m x 145m) for use by GAA, soccer, rugby, cricket and other sporting clubs for organised  games.

Specific Details: The National Cancer Strategy 2017-2026
DPOs Lobbied: Paudie Coffey|Senator|Seanad::Marcella Corcoran Kennedy|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Catherine Ardagh|Senator|Seanad
Subject Matter: The National Cancer Strategy 2017-2026
Intended Results: Increasing the level of awareness with politicians around the prevalence of blood cancer in Ireland
Lobbying Activities: A Make Blood Cancer Visible Forum was held in Dublin with presentations from a leading hematologist, a patient group and a leading expert in the field of blood cancer. This forum impressed upon those in attendance the importance of ensuring that treatments and services are made available to blood cancer patients in Ireland as recommended in the National Cancer Strategy.|Meeting|1

Lobbyist Name: National Infertility Support and Information Group
Specific Details: NISIG is the only Irish charity supporting and advocacy on behalf of those experiencing fertility issues. NISIG is part of a broader AHR Coalition Group comprising LGBT Ireland, 221 Plus group, Equality for Children, Rainbow Families Equality Network, Irish Gay Dads & Independent Living. Main aim of the coalition is to ensure that equality is secured, and the human rights of children conceived using AHR, their intended parents and families are protected and advanced in legislation and policy.
Subject Matter: NISIG is the only Irish charity supporting and advocacy on behalf of those experiencing fertility issues. NISIG is part of a broader AHR Coalition Group comprising LGBT Ireland, 221 Plus group, Equality for Children, Rainbow Families Equality Network, Irish Gay Dads & Independent Living. Main aim of the coalition is to ensure that equality is secured, and the human rights of children conceived using AHR, their intended parents and families are protected and advanced in legislation and policy.
Intended Results: To discuss General Scheme of AHR Bill introduced in 2017 & also the Oireachtas Health Committee Report Recommendations of 2019 at a virtual information event  organised by LGBT Ireland for AHR coalition partners and other interested parties. focusing on  the potential barriers to achieving progressive AHR legislation, priority areas for inclusion in the legislation and also red lines issues in relation to the AHR legislation for the organisations & parties invited to the virtual event::To get an update in relation to both when Public Funding for AHR treatment is due to be made available and also whether any additional Public Funding will be set aside for AHR treatment
Lobbying Activities:
LGBT Ireland organised a virtual AHR roundtable information event in February 2021, to which NISIG, an AHR Coalition partner, amongst other organisations was invited to attend. The discussion at the event concerned  the General Scheme of AHR Bill  introduced in 2017 & also the  Oireachtas Health Committee Report Recommendations of 2019. Discussion included the potential barriers to achieving progressive AHR legislation, priority areas for inclusion in the legislation and also red lines issues for the organisations & parties invited to the event. Both Senator Mary Seery Kearney and Senator Catherine Ardagh attended this information event.|Virtual Meeting|1::Gillian Keegan from NISIG emailed Colm McGennis(Assistant Principal Officer)
Bioethics Unit, Department of Health, asking for an update in relation to the following:
a) Whether any additional Public Funding had been set aside for AHR treatments
b) The timings around when this Public Funding for AHR treatments would be made available.|Email|1
